name: tRNA clan
description: The tRNA clan contains the RNA families tRNA and tmRNA. Homology between these families has been established in the published literature [1-5].

name: RNaseP clan
description: The RNaseP clan contains the RNA families RNaseP_nuc, RNaseP_bact_a, RNaseP_bact_b, RNase_MRP and RNaseP_arch. Homology between these families has been established in the published literature [1-7].

name: SRP clan
description: The SRP clan contains the RNA families for Metazoa_SRP, Bacterial_small_SRP, Bacterial_large_SRP, Fungal_SRP, Plant_SRP, Protozoa_SRP, Archaea_SRP and Dictyostelium_SRP. Homology between these families has been established in the published literature [1-8].

name: Telomerase clan
description: The Telomerase clan contains the RNA families Telomerase-vert, Telomerase-cil and Sacc_telomerase. Homology between these families has been established in the published literature [1-3].

name: U1 clan
description: The U1 clan contains the RNA families U1, U1_yeast and U11. Homology between these families has been established in the published literature [1-4].

name: U2 clan
description: The U2 clan contains the RNA families U2 and U12. Homology between these families has been established in the published literature [1-4].

name: U4 clan
description: The U4 clan contains the RNA families U4 and U4atac. Homology between these families has been established in the published literature [1-5].

name: U54 clan
description: The U54 clan contains the RNA families U54 and snoU54. The following bioinformatic methods were used to confirm the relationship between these families: HMMER3 and PRC [1,2].

name: U6 clan
description: The U6 clan contains the RNA families U6 and U6atac. Homology between these families has been established in the published literature [1-4].

name: Hammerhead clan
description: The Hammerhead clan contains the RNA families Hammerhead_3 and Hammerhead_1. Homology between these families has been established in the published literature [1,2].

name: Glm clan
description: The Glm clan contains the RNA families GlmZ_SraJ and GlmY_tke1. Homology between these families has been established in the published literature [1].

name: SAM clan
description: The SAM clan contains the RNA families SAM, SAM-IV and SAM-I/IV. Homology between these families has been established in the published literature [1].

name: 7SK clan
description: The 7SK clan contains the RNA families 7SK and Arthropod_7SK. Homology between these families has been established in the published literature [1].

name: CRISPR-1 clan
description: The CRISPR-1 clan contains the RNA families CRISPR-DR2, CRISPR-DR4, CRISPR-DR14, CRISPR-DR17, CRISPR-DR25, CRISPR-DR43 and CRISPR-DR66. The following bioinformatic methods were used to confirm the relationship between these families: CMSEARCH, HMMER3 and PRC [1,2,3].

name: CRISPR-2 clan
description: The CRISPR-2 clan contains the RNA families CRISPR-DR5, CRISPR-DR7, CRISPR-DR63 and CRISPR-DR64. The following bioinformatic methods were used to confirm the relationship between these families: CMSEARCH, HMMER3 and PRC [1,2,3].

description: The FinP-traJ clan contains the RNA families FinP and traJ_5. Homology between these families has been established in the published literature [1]. The following bioinformatic methods were used to confirm the relationship between these families: CMSEARCH and PRC [2,3].

name: SNORA2 clan
description: The SNORA2 clan contains the RNA families SNORA16, SNORA2, snopsi28S-3327, snR189, snR46 and S_pombe_snR46. Homology between these families has been established in the published literature [1]. Researchers at the human snoRNA database (snoRNABase) have established that the following human and S. cerevisiae snoRNAs target modifications on orthologous positions of the ribosome: SNORA2 and snR189, SNORA16 and snR46 [2].

name: mir-6 clan
description: The mir-6 clan contains the RNA families mir-6 and mir-11. The following bioinformatic methods were used to confirm the relationship between these families: CMSEARCH, HMMER3 and PRC [1,2,3]. The hexamer seeds of the mature miRNA sequences from these families were manually checked for similarity using sequences obtained from miRBase [4]. This clan had a previous ID of mir-2 however this family was removed from the clan and the ID updated.

name: mir-36 clan
description: The mir-36 clan contains the RNA families mir-35, mir-36 and mir-42. The following bioinformatic methods were used to confirm the relationship between these families: CMSEARCH, HMMER3 and PRC [1,2,3]. The hexamer seeds of the mature miRNA sequences from these families were manually checked for similarity using sequences obtained from miRBase [4].

name: mir-50 clan
description: The mir-50 clan contains the RNA families mir-190 and mir-50. The following bioinformatic methods were used to confirm the relationship between these families: CMSEARCH and PRC [1,2]. The hexamer seeds of the mature miRNA sequences from these families were manually checked for similarity using sequences obtained from miRBase [3].

name: mir-73 clan
description: The mir-73 clan contains the RNA families mir-74 and mir-73. The following bioinformatic methods were used to confirm the relationship between these families: PRC [1]. The hexamer seeds of the mature miRNA sequences from these families were manually checked for similarity using sequences obtained from miRBase [2].

name: mir-81 clan
description: The mir-81 clan contains the RNA families bantam and mir-81. The following bioinformatic methods were used to confirm the relationship between these families: CMSEARCH, HMMER3 and PRC [1,2,3]. The hexamer seeds of the mature miRNA sequences from these families were manually checked for similarity using sequences obtained from miRBase [4].

name: mir-137 clan
description: The mir-137 clan contains the RNA families mir-137 and mir-234. The following bioinformatic methods were used to confirm the relationship between these families: CMSEARCH, HMMER3 and PRC [1,2,3]. The hexamer seeds of the mature miRNA sequences from these families were manually checked for similarity using sequences obtained from miRBase [4].

name: mir-182 clan
description: The mir-182 clan contains the RNA families mir-183, mir-182, mir-263 and mir-228. The following bioinformatic methods were used to confirm the relationship between these families: CMSEARCH, HMMER3 and PRC [1,2,3]. The hexamer seeds of the mature miRNA sequences from these families were manually checked for similarity using sequences obtained from miRBase [4].

name: mir-216 clan
description: The mir-216 clan contains the RNA families mir-216 and mir-283. The following bioinformatic methods were used to confirm the relationship between these families: HMMER3 and PRC [1,2]. The hexamer seeds of the mature miRNA sequences from these families were manually checked for similarity using sequences obtained from miRBase [3].

name: mir-279 clan
description: The mir-279 clan contains the RNA families mir-279 and mir-996. The following bioinformatic methods were used to confirm the relationship between these families: CMSEARCH, HMMER3 and PRC [1,2,3]. The hexamer seeds of the mature miRNA sequences from these families were manually checked for similarity using sequences obtained from miRBase [4].

name: mir-290 clan
description: The mir-290 clan contains the RNA families mir-515, mir-290, mir-302 and miR-430. The following bioinformatic methods were used to confirm the relationship between these families: HMMER3 and PRC [1,2]. The hexamer seeds of the mature miRNA sequences from these families were manually checked for similarity using sequences obtained from miRBase [3].

name: mir-BART clan
description: The mir-BART clan contains the RNA families mir-BART1 and mir-BART3. The following bioinformatic methods were used to confirm the relationship between these families: PRC [1]. The hexamer seeds of the mature miRNA sequences from these families were manually checked for similarity using sequences obtained from miRBase [2].

name: MIR169 clan
description: The MIR169 clan contains the RNA families MIR169_2 and MIR169_5. The following bioinformatic methods were used to confirm the relationship between these families: CMSEARCH, HMMER3 and PRC [1,2,3].

name: MIR171 clan
description: The MIR171 clan contains the RNA families MIR171_1 and MIR171_2. The following bioinformatic methods were used to confirm the relationship between these families: CMSEARCH, HMMER3 and PRC [1,2,3].

name: U3 clan
description: The U3 clan contains the U3 RNA families specific to metazoa, fungi, plants and basal eukaryotes. The homology and divisions between these families has been established in the published literature [1].

name: Cobalamin clan
description: The Cobalamin clan contains the RNA families for Cobalamin riboswitches and the AdoCbl riboswitch from Enterobacteria. The following bioinformatic methods were used to confirm the relationship between these families: CMSEARCH [1]. The relationship and distinction between these RNA families has been noted in the published literature [2,3].

name: Group II catalytic intron D1-D4 clan
description: The group II catalytic intron D1-D4 clan contains the diverse RNA families from the 5` region of group II catalytic intron. Homology between these families has been established in the published literature [1-6].

name: SNORD11 clan
description: The SNORD11 clan contains the RNA families SNORD11 and SNORD11B. The following bioinformatic methods were used to confirm the relationship between these families: HMMER3 and PRC [1,2].

name: Hepadnavirus_epsilon clan
description: The Hepadnavirus_epsilon clan contains the RNA families HBV_epsilon and AHBV_epsilon. Homology between these families has been established in the published literature [1-4].

name: RyeA/RyeB clan
description: The RyeA/RyeB clan contains the RNA families RyeA and RyeB. These two families overlap as part of a bidirectional sRNA locus in E. coli

name: Csr-Rsm protein binding clan
description: The Csr-Rsm clan contains the sRNA families CsrC, RsmB, RsmX, RsmY, RsmZ and TwoAYGGAY. These families are bound by multiple regulatory proteins called CsrA or RsmA. These bind to hairpins containing the sequence motif 'GGA'. Homology between these families has been established in the published literature [1-9].

name: suhB sRNA clan
description: This clan includes the suhB and ar15 sRNAs. The homology between these families is restricted to the second hairpin and Rho-independent terminator of suhB [1].

name: mir-19 clan
description: The mir-19 clan contains the RNA families mir-19 and mir-363. The following bioinformatic methods were used to confirm the relationship between these families: CMSEARCH, HMMER3 and PRC [1,2,3].

name: SSU clan
description: This clan contains the SSU families.

name: LSU clan
description: This clan contains the LSU families.

name: 5S rRNA clan
description: Includes 5S rRNA family with permuted secondary structure.
